lead_paragraph: JACOB--Eva Jacob, nee Neubauer. February 28, 1934 - May 15, 2016. Cherished wife of Fred for over 60 years. Much-loved sister of Frank (Hannah) Neubauer and the late Raymond (Anne Marie) Neubauer; dear mother of Stefanie (Scott Tisdel) and Walter; beloved Oma of Andy and Emmy Tisdel. Escaped Nazi Germany with her family; attended New York's Fieldston School; earned both B.A. summa cum laude and M.A. in English from Radcliffe. Served as curator for the DeCordova Museum, Lincoln, MA; wrote on issues in the arts for Boston publications; worked as Policy and Planning Officer for the National Endowment for the Arts in Washington, DC, 1978-1996, and created the Endowment's Chamber Music Rural Residencies program. Retired early to pursue her love of painting; spent almost five happy years at St. John's on the Lake, Milwaukee, WI. A memorial service will be held at noon on June 12 at St. John's. In lieu of flowers, contributions in her memory may be sent to the Wisconsin Conservatory of Music, 1584 N. Prospect Ave., Milwaukee, WI 53202. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  JACOB, EVA JACOB

In lieu of flowers, contributions in her memory may be sent to the Wisconsin Conservatory of Music, 1584 N. Prospect Ave., Milwaukee, WI 53202. 1/3
